page.title: 02Downlands and Watermeadows
page.content: Chalk Downs rise 500feetabove two roads parallelto thier base.he northerly road runs on a scrub covered ridge of galt above the watermeadows. Rough pastureon the northern slopes of the downs contains typical chalk flora and fauna including hawthorn scrub,bramble,orchids,cowslips,rabbits ,larks,kestrels and an occasional deer. The drain crossed watermeadows, the " Wild Brooks", approached by steep lanes, Bostals, contain a variety of meadow and aquatic plants, rushes, reedmace,willow herb, meadowsweet,yellowflags and some rare species. The Wild Brooks are famous among bird watchers for the water birds which halt here on their annual migrations,including Bewick swans various geese and waders.
